playerOptions.question: It's time to launch the game! You have a few options to do that:

options.resultGood: Only canadians are playing your game, but you managed to fix a few bugs before international release!
options.resultBad: You game is being played by chinese bots, and your mechanic is already being copied

options.resultGood: Microsoft loved your game and decided to invest money on it!
options.resultBad: Who the hell has a windows phone Mr. PO?

options.resultGood: A celebrity played your game and tweeted about it! Revenue is incresing fast worldwide!
options.resultBad: You just discovered that your game has debug texts like Your mom'. WORLDWIDE.

playerOptions.question:
Oops, Your Game Designer, suddenly left work to go get a tatoo!
What do you want to do?

options.resultGood: Oops arrives just in time to help the team with the new features and the Sprint is a success!
options.resultBad: The team had nobody to ask how the new features should work and, somehow, your Cooking Game is now a War FPS.

options.resultGood: The whole team now has awesome tatoos! Everyone gets fired up by it and finishes the Sprint in half the time!
options.resultBad: The team can't shut up about how they wanna make a Tatoo Game next time.

options.resultGood: Oops yells 'Se me atacar, eu vou atacar!', yet, decides to attack first. You fall on your back and raise your feet in the air. Oops sould have some trouble sitting for about a week, but your PO pride is intact.
options.resultBad: The last words you got to hear were 'Se me atacar, eu vou atacar!'. By the time you're awake, you've already become a Slack emoji.

playerOptions.question:
The new Engine update has broken all of the games!
What do we do?

options.resultGood: The devs decided to wait before doing the fixes and started working on features as if the error hadn't hapened. Engine issued a fix later that solved the problems.
options.resultBad: The devs fixed the problems with lots of workarounds. The problem is that Engine issued a fix shrotly afterwards. Now they've gotta undo the workarounds.

options.resultGood: It took a lot of work, but Pizza triumphed against Engine. The studio bought pizza for everyone.
options.resultBad: Rose says she last saw Pizza repeating 'T-ERROR! Nothing can fix the T-ERROR!' over and over. Pizza hasn't been seen since. Later that week another update fixed the problem.

options.resultGood:
The transition to Unity went smoothly and you're now big Unity partners!
 The engine was fixed later, so half of the teams went back to your old engine.
options.resultBad: There were some problems and the Engine Company issued a fix a week later, so everyone just went back to it.

playerOptions.question:
You have received an e-mail from an angry player
saying your App notifications have traumatized their family.

options.resultGood: Fortunately, nothing bad happened. The tale of the Fox, the Boo and the Ghost soon becomes a legend told from the seniors to the juniors.
options.resultBad: The customer cannot live with the trauma and commits suicide. It doesn't generate bad publicity but it gives you trouble sleeping at night.

options.resultGood: You send a heartwarming apology and a free HC pack. The internet notices your act of kindness and the company gets free publicity.
options.resultBad: You send a mild apology that isn't good enough for their trouble. Oh well.

options.resultGood: Your answer quickly grows into an internet Meme, driving further publicity to your game studio.
options.resultBad: You get sued big. What, did you think making fun of a customer was a good idea?

playerOptions.question:
The company's finances haven't been doing well.
What should we sell to make up for it?

options.resultGood: Selling the Ouya made some good money for the company. 'Did we have an Ouya?', was the worker's answers when they heard about the negotiation.
options.resultBad: While trying to sell the Ouya, you stumbled upon the secret Brotherhood of Towerfall. You gave up on selling the Ouya when they started screaming to the sky and pointing their bow and arrows at you.

options.resultGood: You were successful in selling all of the Karaoke equipment, but you felt kinda bad for a few workers, who kept clutching the mike and singing until the very last second, tears flowing from their eyes.
options.resultBad: You told the company that the karaoke was going to be sold. You went to the kitchen later that night and found a group of workers singing sad karaoke songs, bidding it farewell, and decided not to sell it.

options.resultGood: Everyone was saddened to see the Snooker Table go, but they agreed it was for the best. During the Table's last day, legendary games were played and lots of biribas happened. A funeral was held for it the following day.
options.resultBad: Before selling the Snooker Table, the workers gathered to play a few last game on it. Then, suddenly, a biriba went wrong and ended up tearing aparte the table's cloth, which led to the buyer not wanting it any longer... At least we got to keep the table.

playerOptions.question:
The company needs a new hit game to generate some profits.
How do you want to do it?

options.resultGood: Making a lot of games was a success! You identified a theme that work really well and invested on it!
options.resultBad: Making lots of games failed. You shot arrows everywhere, but unfortunately none hit any targets.

options.resultGood: You took a game that was popular and added new features to make a profitable sequel!
options.resultBad: Making a sequel didn't work out. Sadly, less people hang around for sequels rather than new games.

options.resultGood: Your new game was a success! It caused an uproar in the Free-To-Play market and is beng analyzed by Gamasutra! You hit a Gold Mine!
options.resultBad: Making a fully-fledged new game did not work out. Sometimes, it's just better to hold back on investing in a project before making sure that it will work.

playerOptions.question: What is the perfect air conditioning temperature for the office?

options.resultGood: Everyone loves the cold temperature! There is a boost in productivity!
options.resultBad: Icicles prevent some devs from working!

options.resultGood: Everyone agrees this temperature is ideal. There is a boost in productivity, since the team is in sync!
options.resultBad: There is a civil war betwenn devs who want lower and higher temperatures.

options.resultGood: Everyone agrees this temperature this volcanic weather is exactly what the team needs. There is a boost in productivity
options.resultBad: Devs are tired from the extreme heat! :(

playerOptions.question: A major bug was found one hour before release!

options.resultGood: The fix goes live before too many players even notice it.
options.resultBad: The game was unplayable before the fix! Negative reviews flood in.

options.resultGood: Nobody will ever know how close their phones were close to exploding.
options.resultBad: The fix broke even more stuff. Delays and sadness await.

options.resultGood: Turns out the bug allows some stuff the players enjoy. Success!
options.resultBad: There is a flood of negative reviews due to save corruption!

playerOptions.question: Time for some new features in our amazing cooking game!

options.resultGood: Everyone loves our new gacha! Congratz!
options.resultBad: Gacha was costly, and very buggy. It didn't even make it to production.

options.resultGood: Everyone loves this new feature, and players are buying lots of IAPs!
options.resultBad: Customization was a poorly executed reskin, and players are very angry :(

options.resultGood: This new rating is an extreme success! Players are upvoting our game 300% more!
options.resultBad: Aparently, customized rating popups are against the policy of one the major app stores worldwide, and we had to remove it :/
